intellimate.izou.events

Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • intellimate.izou.events.Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Identifiable

    public class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements Identifiable
    This class represents an Event. This class is immutable! for every change it will return an new instance!

      static java.lang.String NOTIFICATION
      Use this type when other AddOns should just notice (they needn't).
      static java.lang.String RESPONSE
      Use this type when other AddOns should react to this Event.

    • Field Detail

      • RESPONSE

        public static final java.lang.String RESPONSE
        Use this type when other AddOns should react to this Event.

      • NOTIFICATION

        public static final java.lang.String NOTIFICATION
        Use this type when other AddOns should just notice (they needn't).

      • FULL_WELCOME_EVENT

        public static final java.lang.String FULL_WELCOME_EVENT
        Event for a Welcome with maximum response. Every component that can contribute should contribute to this Event.

      • MAJOR_WELCOME_EVENT

        public static final java.lang.String MAJOR_WELCOME_EVENT
        Event for a Welcome with major response. Every component that is import should contribute to this Event.

      • MINOR_WELCOME_EVENT

        public static final java.lang.String MINOR_WELCOME_EVENT
        Event for a Welcome with major response. Only components that have information of great importance should contribute to this event.

    • Method Detail

      • createEvent

        public static java.util.Optional<Event> createEvent(java.lang.String type,
                                                    Identification source)
        Creates a new Event Object
        Parameters:
        type - the Type of the Event, try to use the predefined Event types
        source - the source of the Event, most likely a this reference.
        Returns:
        an Optional, that may be empty if type is null or empty or source is null

      • getID

        public java.lang.String getID()
        The ID of the Event. It describes the Type of the Event.

        Returns:
        A String containing an ID

        returns the Source of the Event, e.g. the object who fired it.
        Returns:

      • setDescriptors

        public Event setDescriptors(java.util.List<java.lang.String> descriptors)
        sets the Descriptors (but not the Event-Type).

        Replaces all existing descriptors. Since Event is immutable, it will create a new Instance.

        Parameters:
        descriptors - a List containing all the Descriptors
        Returns:
        the resulting Event (which is the same instance)

      • addDescriptor

        public Event addDescriptor(java.lang.String descriptor)
        sets the Descriptors (but not the Event-Type).
        Parameters:
        descriptor - a String describing the Event.
        Returns:
        the resulting Event (which is the same instance)

      • replaceDescriptors

        public Event replaceDescriptors(java.util.List<java.lang.String> descriptors)
        replaces the Descriptors
        Parameters:
        descriptors - a list containing the Descriptors.
        Returns:
        the resulting Event (which is the same instance)

      • containsDescriptor

        public boolean containsDescriptor(java.lang.String descriptor)
        returns whether the event contains the specific descriptor. this method also checks whether it matches the type.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - a String with the ID of the Descriptor
        Returns:
        boolean when the Event contains the descriptor, false when not.

        can be used for logging.

        Returns:

        Type Parameters:

      • tryFire

        public void tryFire(EventCallable eventCallable,
                    java.util.function.BiFunction<Event,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean> onError)
             throws MultipleEventsException
        tries to fire the Event.

        if calling failed, it will call onError. If onError returns true, it will wait 100 milli-seconds an retries firing. OnError will be called with the parameters: this Event and a counter which increments for every try. If onError returns false, the MultipleEventsException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        eventCallable - the EventCaller used to fire
        onError - this method will be called when an error occurred
        Throws:
        MultipleEventsException - when the method fails to fire the event and onError returns false

      • tryFire

        public void tryFire(EventCallable eventCallable,
                    java.util.function.BiFunction<Event,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean> onError,
                    java.util.function.Consumer<Event> onSuccess)
             throws MultipleEventsException
        tries to fire the Event.

        if calling failed, it will call onError. If onError returns true, it will wait 100 milli-seconds an retries firing. OnError will be called with the parameters: this Event and a counter which increments for every try. If onError returns false, the MultipleEventsException will be thrown. if calling succeeded, it will call onSuccess.

        Parameters:
        eventCallable - the EventCaller used to fire
        onError - this method will be called when an error occurred
        onSuccess - this method will be called when firing succeeded
        Throws:
        MultipleEventsException - when the method fails to fire the event and onError returns false
